page.title: 04CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content: {Midsummer Festival 1985} Middleton Primary School holds a festival every year. This year the theme was children's games. The Fourth Year children wrote letters to newspapers, societies, T.V. and radio programmes. Many replies were received and many appeals broadcast on radio and T.V. Six children collected together the information. Some of the games sent in or found in books were performed. Morris and Maypole dancers danced. Third Year children performed skipping games to rhymes such as, "On A Hillside", "Blackcurrant, Redcurrant" and "Georgie Porgie". Other children performed singing and chanting games. Many purely local games were performed. The information collected is to be put into a book and stored for posterity.
